sushi_plot

sushi_plot.colors

display_color(name)

Accepts name from external script and displays them. Also can display the entire collection.

get_color(name)

Return an array of colors in the theme.

plot_color(name, pallet)

Prints the color pallet

sushi_plot.fmt_plot

latex_plot(val)

Runs the commands to activate latex formating for plots.

Parameters
valbool

True = Activate the Latex format False = Reset the matplotlib paramters to default.

major_ticks(axes, *args)

Sets the distance for the major ticks.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object

*args_1str

Axis Direction. ‘x’ or ‘y’

*args_2float

The ticks will be placed at the multiples of the value provided.

Notes

*args are Positional because arg_1 must be followed by arg_2.

Examples

>>> major_ticks(ax1, "x", 50, "y", 0.005)
minor_ticks(axes, *args)

Turns on the minor tick marks for both the x and y axis.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object

*args_1str

Axis Direction. ‘x’ or ‘y’

*args_2int

Number of ticks.

Notes

*args are Positional because arg_1 must be followed by arg_2. Accepts input for one or both axes. Not case sensitive.

Examples

>>> disp_ticks(ax1, "x", 3, "y", 2)
reset_plot()

Resets matplotlib parameters to the default values.

save_plot(name, size)

Saves the plot in a png format.

Parameters
namestr

Name of the image file.

sizeint

Dots Per Inch (DPI)

tick_label_fmt(axes, **kwargs)

Change the number fomrat of the x or y axis labels. Uses an old-style (‘%’ operator) format string to format the tick.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object

**kwargs

String format for x or y direction.

Notes

Order doesn’t matter.

Examples

>>> tick_label_fmt(x = "%0.3f", y = "%0.3f")
tick_label_size(axes, axis, size=10, **kwargs)

Change the appearance of ticks and tick labels.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object.

axisstr

Axis on which to operate. {‘x’, ‘y’, ‘both’}

sizeint, optional

Label size. Default = 10

**kwargs

Same as tick_params() See matplotlib.axes.Axes.tick_params

ticks(axes, major_size=5, minor_size=3, wide=1)

Turn on the ticks and change the appreance.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object.

major_sizefloat

Size of the major ticks. Default = 5

minor_sizefloat

Size of the minor ticks. Default = 3

wodefloat

Width of the ticks. Both Major and minor. Default = 1

Notes

Default is fine most of the time.

title(axes, name, size=15)

Sets the title and the font size.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object.

namestr

Title.

sizeint, optional

Font size of the title. Defualt = 15

xlabel(axes, name, size=12)

Sets the xlabel and the font size.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object.

namestr

Name of the x axis.

sizeint, optional

Font size of the label. Defualt = 12

ylabel(axes, name, size=12)

Sets the ylabel and the font size.

Parameters
axesmatplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot

Axes object.

namestr

Name of the y axis.

sizeint, optional

Font size of the label. Defualt = 12

sushi_plot.plot_xo

plot_xo(mat, freq_test=[], freq_analysis=[], **kwargs)

Writes out the xo matrix with a contour plot and saves the plot.

Parameters
matnumpy.ndarray

The xo matrix to plot.

freq_testlist, optional

List of mode # and test freqencies nested as a tuple. [(1,2.5), (2,6.8), (3,8.5), …]

freq_analysislist, optional

List of mode # and analysis freqencies nested as a tuple. [(1,2.5), (2,6.8), (3,8.5), …]

font_sizeint, optional

Font size of the matrix values. Not axis lables. Default = 6

cmapbool, optional

Turns of the color map if True. Off if False Default = False

latexbool, optional

Renders the plot in latex format if True. Resets to default if False. Default = False

aspectbool, optional

Sets the aspect ratio of the matrix plot. Default = 1

plot_sizefloat, optional

Horizonal (x in inches) length of the plot. The vertical is set by the aspect ratio. \(y = ap\cdot x\) Default = 7.5

savebool, optional

Saves the plot as a ‘xo.png’ file in local directory. Default = False

Notes

Updated 4/22/2022
